solution_line_template: If Felix drives twice as fast, he will be covering {speed_multiplier}*{average_speed_mph} = <<{speed_multiplier}*{average_speed_mph}={new_speed_mph}>>{new_speed_mph} miles per hour.

In four hours, driving at {new_speed_mph} miles per hour, since distance=speed*time, Felix will cover {new_speed_mph}*{drive_time_hours} = <<{new_speed_mph}*{drive_time_hours}={total_miles_covered}>>{total_miles_covered} miles.
